intro: Dimerandra buenaventurae, commonly known as the Buenaventura dimerandra, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic and milky sap-producing plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
